SEARCH
Package net.elena.murat.math

Class Matrix4

java.lang.Object
net.elena.murat.math.Matrix4
public class Matrix4 extends Object
Represents a 4x4 matrix for 3D transformations (translation, rotation, scaling).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description

  • Method Details

    • identity

      public static Matrix4 identity()
      Returns an identity (unit) 4x4 matrix. An identity matrix has 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere. It represents no translation, rotation, or scaling.
      Returns:
      A new 4x4 identity matrix.

    • set

      public void set(int row, int col, double value)
      Sets the value at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-3)
      col - The column index (0-3)
      value - The value to set
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if row or col is not in [0, 3]

    • getScaleX

      public double getScaleX()
      Gets the X-axis scale factor from this transformation matrix. This is calculated as the magnitude of the X basis vector.
      Returns:
      The X scale factor

    • getScaleY

      public double getScaleY()
      Gets the Y-axis scale factor from this transformation matrix. This is calculated as the magnitude of the Y basis vector.
      Returns:
      The Y scale factor

    • getScaleZ

      public double getScaleZ()
      Gets the Z-axis scale factor from this transformation matrix. This is calculated as the magnitude of the Z basis vector.
      Returns:
      The Z scale factor

    • transformRay

      public Ray transformRay(Ray ray)

    • transformDirection

      public Vector3 transformDirection(Vector3 v)
      Transforms a direction vector by this matrix. Unlike points, vectors are not affected by translation. Only the rotational and scaling components are applied. This is used for transforming normal vectors, ray directions, etc.
      Parameters:
      v - The direction vector to transform
      Returns:
      A new transformed Vector3

    • get

      public double get(int row, int col)
      Provides access to a specific element of the matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-3).
      col - The column index (0-3).
      Returns:
      The matrix element at the specified position.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the row or column index is invalid.

    • transformNormal

      public Vector3 transformNormal(Vector3 normal)
      Normal vektörü dönüştürür (normal transformasyonu için). Normal vektörlerin doğru dönüşümü için matrisin ters transpozu kullanılır.
      Parameters:
      normal - Dönüştürülecek normal vektör
      Returns:
      Dönüştürülmüş normal vektör (normalize edilmiş)

    • multiply

      public Matrix4 multiply(Matrix4 other)
      Multiplies this matrix by another matrix.
      Parameters:
      other - The other Matrix4 to multiply with.
      Returns:
      The resulting Matrix4.

    • transformPoint

      public Point3 transformPoint(Point3 point)
      Transforms a Point3 by this matrix (includes translation). For affine transformations, the W component of the transformed point should be 1.0.
      Parameters:
      point - The Point3 to transform.
      Returns:
      The transformed Point3.

    • transformVector

      public Vector3 transformVector(Vector3 vector)
      Transforms a Vector3 by this matrix (only rotation and scaling, no translation).
      Parameters:
      vector - The Vector3 to transform.
      Returns:
      The transformed Vector3.

    • inverse

      public Matrix4 inverse()
      Returns the inverse of this matrix. Returns null if the matrix is non-invertible. This method is designed for affine transformations (rotation, translation, uniform scaling). Formula: [ R | t ]^-1 = [ R^-1 | -R^-1 * t ] Where R is the upper-left 3x3 submatrix and t is the translation vector.
      Returns:
      The inverse Matrix4 or null.

    • inverseTransposeForNormal

      public Matrix4 inverseTransposeForNormal()
      Computes the inverse transpose of the upper 3x3 part of this matrix. This is typically used to transform normal vectors correctly when the model matrix contains non-uniform scaling. For pure rotations, the inverse is equal to the transpose.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix4 representing the inverse transpose of the 3x3 part, with the translation components set to zero. Returns null if the upper 3x3 part is non-invertible.

    • translate

      public static Matrix4 translate(Vector3 translation)
      Creates a translation matrix.
      Parameters:
      translation - The translation vector.
      Returns:
      The translation Matrix4.

      public static Matrix4 translate(double x, double y, double z)

      public static Matrix4 rotateX(double angleDegrees)
      Creates a rotation matrix around the X-axis.
      Parameters:
      angleDegrees - The rotation angle in degrees.
      Returns:
      The rotation Matrix4.

      sy - The Y-axis scale factor.

      Returns:
      The scaling Matrix4.

    • fromMatrix3

      public static Matrix4 fromMatrix3(Matrix3 m3)
      Creates a Matrix4 from a Matrix3 (typically to extend rotation matrices to 4x4).
      Parameters:
      m3 - The Matrix3 to extend.
      Returns:
      The created Matrix4.

    • multiply

      public Matrix4 multiply(double scalar)
      Multiplies this matrix by a scalar value (each element is multiplied by the scalar).
      Parameters:
      scalar - The scalar value to multiply with.
      Returns:
      A new Matrix4 with each element multiplied by the scalar.

    • createMatrixFromString

      public static Matrix4 createMatrixFromString(String transformString)
      Creates a Matrix4 from a transformation string in the format: "transform = translate(x, y, z) * rotate(rx, ry, rz) * scale(sx, sy, sz);"
      Parameters:
      transformString - The transformation string to parse
      Returns:
      The resulting Matrix4 transformation matrix
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the string format is invalid

    • add

      public static Matrix4 add(Matrix4 trsA, Matrix4 trsB)
      Adds the transform values (tx,ty,tz,rx,ry,rz,sx,sy,sz) of two matrices. Sums the transform values of trsB to trsA and returns a new Matrix4 with the result.
      Parameters:
      trsA - The first matrix (base matrix)
      trsB - The second matrix (matrix to add)
      Returns:
      A new Matrix4 with the summed transform values
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either matrix is null
